page.title: 02William Hanbury 1725 - 1778
page.content: In {1749} William Hanbury's father bought him the living of the Langtons.He wanted to build a hospital, cathedral and school here. He grew thousands of trees and sold them to land owners, investing the money, some of which was used to build the original school in{1873.}This is now a camp school where Leicestershire children can stay to learn about the countryside. Of the two school houses, one is now the cook's house, the other is empty. The hall and caretaker's house were built in {1924}and the present primary school in {1936.}Today the interest on his money (the Trust Fund) still helps people at college and old people at Christmas. The casework of the organ he bought still exists. He was buried in an octagonal mausoleum and later reburied in a vault under the vestry.
